designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Category for a taxon when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual potentially capble of reproduction within the region has died or has disappeared from the wild in the region, or when, if it is a former visiting taxon, the last individual has died or disappeared in the wild from the region. The setting of any time limit for listing under RE is left to the discretion of the regional Red List authority, but should not normally pre-date 1500 AD.
designations.comments: Formerly Roemeria hybrida. An archaeophyte formerly naturalised in arable fields in E. Anglia. Extinct: last record, 1956 (D. A. Pearman pers. comm.)
